result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. LaDell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C. LaDell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Granting Motion for Return of Seized Property Under Sec. 968.20, Wis. Stats.

1:36 pm  Defendant Joseph C. LaDell not in court. Prosecuting Atty Matthew R. Leusink appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Defendant Joseph C. LaDell.
Court had previously excused defendant's appearance for today.
Defendant's Motion for Return of Seized Property.  
The property seized was not used in the commission of this crime but items were taken for safe-keeping during subsequent investigation.
Court hears from both sides.
1:44 pm  Court will grant return of seized property.  Attorney Duquette to draft order.
Minutes filed.
Defendant Joseph C. LaDell in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Attorney James B. Duquette appeared.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Remains. Motion deadline 04-01-16. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Joseph Carl La Dell present in court with Atty James Duquette. Cody Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Trial reserved. Bond remains. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH SCOT INDUSTRIES OR 2277 NORTH ST., OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES OR THEIR RESIDENCES.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
